author: @eldeber
title: César Apaza a sus juzgadores: “Dios los perdone” | El Deber
text: PAÍS PAÌS César Apaza a sus juzgadores: “Dios los perdone” Adepcoca dio un plazo hasta el 8 de enero para que dejen en libertad a su afiliado En la última audiencia de apelación, planteada por la defensa del dirigente cocalero César Apaza, él pudo hacer uso de la defensa material y, por primera vez, se escuchó su voz en una sesión judicial. El malogrado dirigente pidió que lo dejen defenderse en libertad y atender su estado de salud y acusó a la Fiscalía de dilatar su proceso. “Todo este tiempo dilataron, con el falso argumento que siempre han usado: que hay personas declaradas en rebeldía; que faltan cumplir órdenes de aprehensión, así manejan la justicia. Por eso digo, se los voy a decir siempre, al señor juez (Juan Carlos) Montalbán: 'Dios te perdone'. A los fiscales: 'Dios los perdone y les guarde misericordia”, dijo Apaza, con una voz pesada, que denotaba la dificultad que tenía para hablar. Apaza está detenido de manera preventiva, desde septiembre de 2022, cuando fue aprehendido en un violento operativo realizado por la Policía en el mercado de Adepcoca. La Fiscalía lo acusa de haber cometido 15 delitos, sin embargo, hasta el momento no presentó su caso ante un juez y la detención preventiva fue ampliada. “Son 15 meses y seis días de privado de libertad sin prueba alguna, hasta la fecha; lo único que le voy a pedir señora magistrada (dirigiéndose a la vocal Rosmery Lourdes Pabón), es que se me permita defenderme en libertad; no estoy pidiendo que se cierre el caso, más al contrario, soy el más interesado en que puedan estar aquí, adentro ,en la cárcel, los verdaderos autores de esos delitos”, expresó el dirigente cocalero. Sus compañeros de Adepcoca dieron un plazo al Gobierno y a la justicia de dejarlo en libertad hasta el 8 de enero, y adelantaron que tomarán medidas de presión puesto que, hasta el momento, las autoridades desoyen los pedidos humanitarios y argumentos de inocencia que tiene Apaza en su proceso.

author: AFP Import
title: France/Monde - Salvador: la face obscure de la "guerre contre les gangs" de Bukele
text: Si la criminalité s'est effondrée dans le pays d'Amérique centrale, des organisations de défense de droits humains comme Amnesty international ou au Salvador le Mouvement des victimes du régime (Movir), dénoncent détentions arbitraires, mauvais traitements, cas de torture et même des décès dans les prisons. \"Certaines arrestations étaient fondées sur le seul fait que les personnes concernées avaient des tatouages, un casier judiciaire ou vivaient dans une zone contrôlée par des gangs\", dit Amnesty dans son rapport de décembre 2023. Sandra, Maricela, Josefina et Irma, mères ou grand-mères de familles ayant en commun de vivre dans une extrême pauvreté, affirment à l'AFP que leurs proches sont des victimes innocentes des dérives de l'état d'urgence. - \"Des innocents meurent\" - Sandra Hernandez, 36 ans, mère de deux enfants de 17 et 13 ans, raconte dans sa maison sans eau ni électricité, à 50 km de San Salvador, l'arrestation de son mari, le 26 mai 2022. \"Ils l'ont accusé d'appartenance à un gang. Il n'avait pas de tatouages\", assure-t-elle. En prison, José Medrano est tombé malade, souffrant d'insuffisance rénale. La dernière fois que Sandra Hernandez et ses enfants l'ont vu, c'est lors d'un appel vidéo au moment de son transfert à l'hôpital pour une hémodialyse. Il y décédera le 26 mars 2023. \"Des innocents meurent, pas les membres des gangs (...) Ce qu'ils ont fait, c'est instaurer la terreur, et ce sont les pauvres gens qui tombent\", fustige-t-elle. - \"Peur qu'ils m'emmènent\" - Maricela Méndez raconte avoir été arrêtée chez elle, à Alta Vista, dans le nord-est de San Salvador, le 19 juillet 2022 et ses enfants alors âgés de 11 et 7 ans confiés à leur grand-mère. \"Ils m'ont accusée d'être une délinquante du quartier, la police avait un quota de cinq arrestations\", affirme-t-elle estimant avoir été dénoncée sans preuves par des voisins. Elle a séjourné dans trois prisons, dormant à même le sol, nourrie de simples galettes de maïs et d'eau sucrée. \"Ils nous punissaient, nous battaient, ne nous donnaient pas d'eau\". Enceinte lors de son arrestation, elle a obtenu une libération conditionnelle deux mois avant l'accouchement. A sa sortie, son mari l'avait quittée. Cette mère de 35 ans qui travaille dans un salon de beauté dit ses enfants \"traumatisés\". \"Lorsqu'ils voient une patrouille de police, ils pleurent, ils ont peur qu'ils m'emmènent à nouveau. Je ressens la même peur\". - \"Ils n'enquêtent pas\" - Les yeux gonflés d'avoir mal dormi à côté du berceau où se reposent ses petits-enfants de deux et trois ans et demi, Josefina Bonilla essuie ses larmes. Elle dit n'avoir \"pas de nouvelles\" de sa fille Stefany Santos, 24 ans, arrêtée le 2 juin 2022. La grand-mère évoque un conflit avec la famille du père, assassiné pour un problème de dettes. \"Elle est innocente. Ils arrêtent des gens et n'enquêtent pas\", affirme-t-elle dans sa modeste maison de Soyapango, disant vivre grâce à l'aide de voisins. \"Ma fille est asthmatique et a des problèmes psychologiques. Je suis inquiète qu'elle n'ait pas de médicaments\", se lamente-t-elle, déplorant qu'en un an et demi, elle n'ait pu lui apporter que trois colis de nourriture et de vêtements. - Avenir \"volé\" - Irma Garcia, 42 ans, dit vouloir parler pour ne plus se sentir \"impuissante\" après l'arrestation de son fils, bientôt 18 ans ce 7 juin 2022, dans l'atelier de mécanique où il travaillait. \"Depuis qu'ils l'ont emmené, je ne l'ai plus vu. Je ne sais pas s'il va bien, s'il est vivant\", dit-elle dans sa chambre à Mejicanos, au nord de San Salvador. \"Mon fils n'est pas membre d'un gang, il n'a pas de tatouages, il n'a fait de mal à personne\", assure-t-elle, évoquant une dénonciation anonyme. \"Ils arrêtent des jeunes innocents, ils volent leurs rêves, leur avenir, comme celui de mon fils\", se lamente cette veuve, mère de trois autres enfants de 13, 15 et 21 ans qui dit vivre \"avec l'inquiétude qu'on me dise qu'il a été tué\".

author: Utilisateur anonyme
title: Météo : un fort risque de pluies verglaçantes ce week-end dans l'Aisne
text:
Météo : un fort risque de pluies verglaçantes ce week-end dans l’Aisne
Un samedi très frais avant un dimanche beaucoup plus doux. Voici comment on pourrait résumer la météo de ce week-end du 4 et 5 janvier 2025 dans l’Aisne. On fait le point pour les deux jours.
Samedi 4 janvier
[Comme la veille](/id675997/article/2025-01-02/meteo-la-marne-et-laisne-prolonges-en-vigilance-jaune-neige-verglas-jusqua-ce), du verglas pourrait faire son apparition. « La nuit de vendredi à samedi sera généralement calme et froide sur de nombreuses régions, avec des gelées très nombreuses (…) sur la moitié nord », indique Météo France. Un ciel voilé avec des températures négatives est en effet annoncé. Un temps très nuageux mais pas pluvieux est ensuite attendu pour toute la journée avec un mercure oscillant autour des 0°C.
Ce n’est que durant la nuit de samedi à dimanche que les précipitations vont arriver. Météo France annonce des pluies verglaçantes dans la quasi-totalité du département. Quelques flocons de neige sont également à prévoir en Thiérache.
Dimanche 5 janvier
Le temps pluvieux va ensuite se poursuivre durant toute la journée de dimanche. En revanche, une forte remontée des températures sera observée en raison d’un « air très doux qui envahira progressivement la moitié nord », détaille Météo France qui explique qu’« il fera ainsi très doux dès le début de journée. »
Les 10 degrés seront ainsi atteints dès le matin dans le sud du département ou dans le Laonnois. L’après-midi, on comptera 11°C à Saint-Quentin et Laon ou encore 12°C du côté de Soissons et Château-Thierry.
Ce redoux des températures se poursuivra dans la journée de lundi. Le mercure retrouvera ensuite des valeurs plus propices à la saison hivernale dès le mardi 7 janvier.

author: vanguardia
title: Podría perder una mano policía de Saltillo agredido con un machete
text: Podría perder una mano policía de Saltillo agredido con un machete ANDREA RIOJAS La Fiscalía General del Estado inició una carpeta de investigación luego de que fuera registrada una riña entre cinco personas, dos agentes policiales y un individuo desconocido en la colonia Bonanza el pasado miércoles donde un elemento de policía terminó herido de gravedad, quien recibió un machetazo en una de sus manos. De acuerdo con la Fiscalía General del Estado, los elementos arribaron al lugar por un reporte de venta de drogas, sin embargo, fue hasta alrededor de las 23:00 horas del pasado miércoles 12 de junio, cuando mediante grupos de seguridad se reportaron detonaciones de arma de fuego sobre la calle Yeso de la colonia Bonanza. Hasta el lugar se dirigieron autoridades para corroborar el hecho, sin embargo, indicaron que en el lugar señalado no se encontraba ninguna novedad. Esto fue desmentido por vecinos, quienes indicaron que justo a esa hora, cinco hermanos de nombre Rafael, Arnoldo, Abel, Jovany y Samuel, que se dedican a recolectar basura se encontraban a las afueras de su domicilio marcado con el número #419, cuando de manera inesperada arribaron dos personas que se identificaron como “elementos de la Fiscalía General del Estado”, aunque esto último fue desmentido por la FGE, aclarando que su personal solo acudió a realizar el reporte de los hechos. Los agentes policiales mencionan que después de acudir a atender el reporte, fueron recibidos a golpes y agresiones ocasionando una riña. Uno de los elementos supuestamente accionó su arma de fuego para dispersar la trifulca; sin embargo, fue lesionado de gravedad en una mano con un machete por un individuo aún no identificado. El oficial lesionado fue intervenido quirúrgicamente después del ataque con el machete y se encuentra hospitalizado con pocas probabilidades de recuperar la total movilidad de su mano. Por el momento se desconoce la identidad del perpetrador de la agresión, sin embargo, la FGE reporta que ya se tiene un detenido y se ha comenzado una carpeta de investigación, por lo podría ser vinculado a proceso las siguientes 24 horas. Estos hechos ocurrieron luego de que la noche del pasado martes en la colonia Mirasierra, al oriente de [Saltillo](https://saltillo.gob.mx/), se produjo una movilización importante de patrullas en la que un oficial de tránsito resultó herido por golpes propinados por un joven que se resistió al aseguramiento de una moto.

author: NewsBreak Original
title: Man shot dead by school police in shooting incident at Franklin High School in El Paso
text:
By Jeremiah Hassel ,
2 days ago A man in his 50s was shot to death by an El Paso Independent School District police officer on Thursday, it was reported, as classes were canceled amid the violent event .
The incident unfolded along the perimeter of Franklin High School at approximately 6 a.m. on Thursday. EPSID officers reportedly encountered the individual and shot him dead, though the details of the incident were hazy.
EPSID Police Department Chief Manuel Chavira told reporters during a news conference that the shooting was an isolated incident and that no students were or are in danger. Nevertheless, classes were canceled pending an ongoing investigation.
Fort Worth teenager, 16, shot dead by grown man after video game 'smack talk' turned violent
Three murdered in Indianapolis parking lot in 'Wild West' shoot out as Honduran family blood feud explored in US
There had only been cross-country athletes at the school at the time of the incident, the El Paso Times reported, but none were near the area of the shooting, Chavira confirmed to the publication.
The students present at the school were immediately placed in lockdown and were safe the entire time, it was reported. Classes are expected to resume on Friday at the high school, which is located in West El Paso.
It was only the high school that suffered canceled classes, too, as that's where the incident occurred. District officials told the El Paso Times that classes were scheduled to take place as usual for the rest of the day on Thursday at all the district's other campuses.
Click here to follow the Mirror US on Google News to stay up to date with all the latest news, sports and entertainment stories.
A body in a white sheet was reportedly spotted outside the school just before classes were slated to begin on Thursday morning, the publication reported, and red crime scene tape could be seen blocking off the gravel outside the school, which is located at 900 N. Resler Dr., local TV station KFOX reported, showing images of the scene.
Amanda Bowser, the school's principal, released a statement on Franklin High School's website about the shooting, calling it an "overnight incident."
She wrote, "Due to an overnight incident that occurred at Franklin High School, all classes have been canceled for today. Law enforcement is investigating, please stay clear of the area. The safety of our students and staff is our top priority, and we are working closely with authorities to address the situation. Thank you for your understanding."
According to KFOX, the El Paso Police Department is assisting the EPSID police with the investigation. EPSID also released a statement about the early morning incident.
"The El Paso Independent School District PD was involved in a shooting at Franklin High School while investigating an early morning incident. This incident did not involve any students, and there is no danger to the community, students, or staff," the district wrote, according to KFOX. "One person died as a result of this incident. Outside agencies are assisting El Paso ISD with the investigation. Further communication will be provided as more information becomes available."
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: Tim Stanley Tulsa World
title: Oklahoma Senate rejects Welch girls accessory to murder bill
text: A bill named for the two teenage victims in one of Oklahoma's most notorious cold cases was effectively killed Thursday by the Senate in a baffling turn of events for surviving family members and the bill's author. Known as Lauria and Ashley's Law, House Bill 2946, which the Senate declined to hear, would require anyone convicted of accessory to murder to serve at least 85% of their sentence before becoming eligible for parole. The law is named in memory of 16-year-olds Lauria Bible and Ashley Freeman, who authorities believe were kidnapped outside of Welch in 1999, tortured, raped and killed. Sen. Greg McCortney, R-Ada, Senate floor leader, said the decision not to hear the bill was "based on not going backward on criminal justice reform." "While I wholeheartedly agree that the facts and circumstances surrounding the case in question are horrific and my heart goes out to the families involved, it is the job of the Senate to craft and pass sound public policy, while not undermining the will of Oklahomans," McCortney said in a statement. People are also reading… Lorene Bible, mother of Lauria Bible, said the news of the bill's fate was devastating to her family and that finding out at the "last minute" made it that much worse. "For 24 years I felt like I'd done everything I could do for my child until (Wednesday) night," when she learned that the bill wouldn't be heard, said Bible, who traveled to the Capitol on Thursday to talk to senators. "What does it take to open people's eyes? We filed this so this doesn't happen to another family. That's the whole reason we're doing it." The bill, filed last year by Rep. Steve Bashore, R-Miami, was crafted in response to the early release of the only person ever held responsible in the case. Ronnie Dean Busick, 72, was released in May 2023 from Lexington Correctional Center after serving only 2½ years of a 10-year sentence for accessory to murder. He's due to come off supervised probation next month. "They keep telling me he has rights. Well, this man has more rights than I do," Bible said Thursday. Bashore said the message sent by the decision not to hear the bill is that "victims' rights are not important." He said he was originally told the bill wouldn't be heard because there wasn't enough time. The bill passed the House on Feb. 21 by a vote of 85-13 and had also cleared the Senate Judiciary Committee. The proposed law would add accessory to murder in the first or second degree to a list of crimes that require an offender to serve at least 85% of their prison sentence before being parole eligible. Those convicted would not be eligible for any credits that would reduce the sentence to below 85% of what was imposed. Busick earned credits to reduce his sentence under state law, while also receiving credit for county jail time served while awaiting trial. McCortney, in his statement Thursday, added: "The mission of the Department of Corrections in part is to rehabilitate and prepare individuals convicted of crimes to reenter society. The individual who pled guilty in this case was released based on earned credits from policy decisions at the Department of Corrections, not the Senate." "Statistics have made it clear that Oklahoma previously led the nation and parts of the world in overincarceration. The demands for reform reached a fever pitch and the state legislature, our current governor, as well as voters, acted to make the conscious decision that we needed criminal justice reform, and we acted accordingly. This measure would run counter to that collective goal." The Bible family is vowing not to give up, however. "We are fighters, if nothing else," said Lisa Bible Brodrick, a cousin of Lauria Bible's. "We will go back to the drawing board and trust Rep. Bashore to guide us again next year with a better understanding of what we need to do differently." Busick, who pleaded guilty to the charge in August 2020, is the lone survivor from a trio believed to be behind the disappearance of the two 16-year-olds and the murders of Freeman's parents, Danny and Kathy Freeman, on Dec. 30, 1999, outside of Welch. Authorities believe that the girls were also murdered, and periodic searches for their bodies are still ongoing. The case was cold for years, but after a break in 2018, prosecutors charged Busick while also implicating the late Warren Phillip Welch II and David A. Pennington. Investigators believe that the trio went to the Freeman farm to confront Danny Freeman about a drug debt. After the murders of Freeman and his wife, the girls likely were kidnapped. Investigators believe they were taken to a trailer house in Picher, where they were tortured and sexually assaulted for two weeks before being killed. Busick's release came as a shock, Bible said at the time. She said the family was never informed that earlier release was a possibility and that they never would've supported the plea deal if they had known.

author: JJ Staff
title: Dua Lipa Drops Music Video for New Single ‘Illusion’ – Read the Lyrics & Watch Now! | Dua Lipa, First Listen, Lyrics, Music, Music Video
text: Dua Lipa Drops Music Video for New Single 'Illusion' - Read the Lyrics & Watch Now! [Dua Lipa](https://www.justjared.com/tags/dua-lipa/) has a new song and music video out! On Thursday (April 11), the 28-year-old Grammy-winning entertainer debuted her brand new single “Illusion” and the music video to go along with it. “I already know your type, tellin’ me the things I like (Mm) / Tryna make me yours for life, takin’ me for a ride (Mm),” Dua sings. “I already know your type, think you playin’ your cards right (Mm) / Don’t you know I could do this dance all night?” In the video directed by Tanu Muino, Dua is joined by dancers, high divers, and synchronized swimmers at the Piscina Municipal de Montjuïc in Barcelona, Spain. The pool also served as the location for [Kylie Minogue](https://www.justjared.com/tags/kylie-minogue/)‘s “Slow” music video! Keep reading to find out more…“Illusion” is now the third single off of Dua‘s upcoming third studio album Radical Optimism, which she will be releasing on May 3rd. In a new interview, Dua‘s boyfriend [Callum Turner](https://www.justjared.com/tags/callum-turner/) revealed [ which of her songs is his favorite](https://www.justjared.com/2024/03/29/callum-turner-reveals-which-of-girlfriend-dua-lipas-songs-is-his-favorite/). You can pre-order Radical Optimism off of [iTunes here](https://music.apple.com/us/album/radical-optimism/1734980417) and watch the “Illusion” music video below! Keep scrolling to read all of the lyrics… [Dua Lipa](https://www.justjared.com/tags/dua-lipa/), [First Listen](https://www.justjared.com/tags/first-listen/), [Lyrics](https://www.justjared.com/tags/lyrics/), [Music](https://www.justjared.com/tags/music/), [Music Video](https://www.justjared.com/tags/music-video/)

author: 13 ON YOUR SIDE Staff
title: West Michigan school closings
text: GRAND RAPIDS, Mich. — Although spring officially started on Tuesday, [ winter is not over yet](/article/weather/forecast/weather-forecast/69-19905200)! Snow is rolling across West Michigan Friday, bringing with it the potential for anywhere between four to eight inches of snow. The snowfall has already started and is anticipated to continue until about midnight. Snowfall totals are expected to be at their highest between the morning and evening commutes. Because of this, some schools in West Michigan have called for a snow day on Friday. Check to see if your child's school is closed [here.](/closings) Most areas in West Michigan will see at least four inches of snow, though some areas are set up to receive more. Kent, Muskegon, Ionia and Montcalm counties are anticipated to get at least six inches of snow. Areas below that will get about four inches. There is the potential for higher amounts depending on how the system sets up. Road crews began preparing for the snowy weather Thursday, as travel impacts are expected throughout the day. Drivers are encouraged to slow down, leave extra room between vehicles and give themselves plenty of time to reach their destination. Stick with the 13 ON YOUR SIDE Weather Team while we track this snowstorm throughout Friday. ►Make it easy to keep up to date with more stories like this. Download the 13 ON YOUR SIDE app now . Have a news tip? Email [news@13onyourside.com](mailto:news@wzzm13.com?subject=Story%20idea), visit our Facebook page or YouTube channel . Watch 13 ON YOUR SIDE for free on Roku , Amazon Fire TV Stick , and on your phone.

author: BC Rugby
title: 2025 BC Rugby Senior Club Finals Heading to Abbotsford
text:
End-of-season finale on May 3 to feature seven Championship Finals.
BC Rugby is delighted to confirm the 2025 BC Rugby Senior Club Finals will take place at Abbotsford Exhibition Park, home of Abbotsford RFC, on Saturday, May 3 – buy your tickets now!
Featuring seven Championship Finals from BC Rugby’s Senior Club Leagues, including the BC Rugby Men’s Premier League and BC Rugby Women’s Premier League, the action will be split across two fields as the flagship end-of-season celebration makes an exciting return to the BC Rugby calendar.
Attendees can take advantage of an early bird 25% discount on tickets. Tickets will be priced at $7.50 for ages 14-18 and $15 for ages 19+ until 11:55pm on Sunday, April 6, 2025.
After April 6, tickets will be priced at $10 for ages 14-18 and $20 for anyone aged 19+. Tickets can be purchased online and will also be available on the day of the event. Admission is free for all Under-13s.
Tickets are available to purchase online here.
With over 2000 fans expected at Abbotsford Exhibition Park on May 3, the 2025 BC Rugby Senior Club Finals event promises to be an action-packed day.
The following BC Rugby Senior Club League Finals will be contested:
- Men’s Premier League
- Women’s Premier League
- Men’s Division 1
- Women’s Division 1
- Men’s Division 2
- Women’s Division 2
- Men’s Division 3
Keep an eye out on BC Rugby’s social media channels to find out quarter, semi, and final Team rankings before the Championship matches. Championship matches will take place across two fields, with Teams, Officials and spectators being able to enjoy plenty of Rugby in a picturesque setting.
A full day schedule will be released once all finalists are confirmed. Ahead of the event, BC Rugby will launch a 2025 BC Rugby Senior Club Finals web page featuring key information including what to expect on the day, live streaming details and more.
More information about BC Rugby
The British Columbia Rugby Union, commonly known as BC Rugby, is the governing body for Rugby in British Columbia and is a Provincial Union of Rugby Canada, the national governing body. Representing over 8,000 individuals registered through around 65 Member Clubs and Associations across the Province, BC Rugby leads and manages the sport with the aim to grow participation and develop excellence in all games of Rugby and in all facets of the sport.
Web: www.bcrugby.com
Social: @bcrugbyunion
–30–
For more information or additional photos, please contact:
BC Rugby
Rob Bartlett, Director of Marketing and Partnerships
Tel: +1 778-725-7476rbartlett@bcrugby.com

author: Gary2024
title: Cannot pair phone adapter to my Archer VR2100.
text:
Hi,
Since installing my new BT homehub and phone adapter, I have found that the throughput of the internet is poor. The BB speed is reported as 59Mbs in the hub admin, is only actually 45Mbs when tested with Ookla (why do BT lie about speeds? but I have to wait5 secs or more for the 'wheel' to stop spinning and the site to appear.
I re-installed my Archer VR2100 and the throughput increased to less than 1 sec to display a website, perfect. I then tried to pair the phone adapter, no luck.
1. Is it possible to fix this or has BT tied the adapter down to only the BT Home Hub? This was not explained when I purchased the service and will restult in my cancelling the contract.
2. Can the slow throughput of the BT Home Hub be fixed. Also note you cannot change the DNS settings from BT's to Google for better performance. BT should really be thinking of its customers needs, not theirs.
Regards (and very annoyed)
Gary
Digital Voice only works with the SH2.
DVAs pair to a DECT base in the SH2, not over WiFi, so will never connect to your router. Not that it would work anyway.
Maybe download a WiFi analyser to check for competing channels from neighbours. It may simply be that your router is using different channels.
If you go back to Plusnet for broadband you will have to use a third party VOIP provider for the phone as Plusnet are now broadband only.
